gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Petroleum Reservoir Fields (Oil and Gas): Indiana, 2015

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP is an Esri polygon shapefile that depicts the locations and extents of all petroleum reservoir fields in Indiana, as of January 8, 2015. PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP shows boundaries of petroleum reservoir fields that enclose petroleum wells that are classified as producing from a single field, but does not necessarily indicate the maximum extent of the producing reservoir field.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP was created to provide the Indiana Geological Survey and the public with a functional digital representation of petroleum reservoir fields in Indiana for use in geographic information systems.

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS point shapefile (version 10.2), Windows 7, 1.0 MB

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This dataset is assumed to be complete up to the publication date, but is continually being updated by IGS personnel.

The attributes associated with the item FIELD_NAME were transcribed from labels shown on the Indiana Geological Survey's existing Petroleum Exploration Maps. Therefore, attribute accuracy of this coverage is dependent on the accuracy of the original maps. The attribute accuracy was tested by manual comparison of the source with hard copy plots and (or) symbolized display of the digital petroleum fields data on screen. Despite the use of careful procedures and proofing of the entered data, human error always remains a possibility.

Petroleum reservoir field boundaries are derived from the locations of specific wells in the IGS Petroleum Well Database, a component of the Petroluem Database Management System (PDMS). Therefore, the horizontal positional accuracy of this dataset is dependent on the locational accuracy of those well locations. The petroleum well locations have varying levels of accuracy. Location coordinates of wells contained within the Indiana Geological Surveys Petroleum Database Management System are believed to be reasonably accurate when portrayed on a scale of 1 inch to 1 mile (1:63,360). Although the coordinates for a great many locations in the database have been very accurately determined, past practices and inherent limitations on the accuracy with which a well was spotted on a 1:24,000-scale USGS topographic map have resulted in well coordinates that locate wells a small distance from their actual locations. Depending on circumstances, this distance could be as great as 100 feet, or rarely, somewhat more. In general, such locations are sufficiently accurate for most petroleum exploration and field mapping purposes. Additionally, it is important to note that new and revised data continually are being entered into the Petroleum Well Database and, despite the use of careful procedures and proofing of the entered data, human error always remains a possibility. Every effort is made to correct errors and discrepancies whenever they are identified, but it is the responsibility of the user to verify any information to the extent it is deemed important.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of this dataset.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This process step outlines the procedures used to update the petroleum reservoir field boundaries. The Petroleum Database Management System is continually being updated. As petroleum wells are added and well locations are updated, PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP often needs to be revised. This is carried out by IGS personnel who edit PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP when necessary. PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP reservoir field boundaries are updated by using the most current petroleum well record data to buffer boundaries around petroleum wells that are classified as producing from a specific reservoir field, as contained in the IGS Petroleum Well Database, a component of the Petroleum Database Management System (PDMS).

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: PDMS well records from the IGS Petroleum Well Database

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

This source provided the location and attribute information for petroleum wells which were buffered to create layers showing the approximate extent of petroleum reservoir field boundaries (one quarter mile radius around producing wells).

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Only a select set of wells from the PDMS were used to generate buffers to use as guides for digitizing petroleum field outlines. All productive wells were used including those with the following symbol classifications: oil, gas, oil and gas, shut-in gas, gas storage, gas storage formerly oil, gas storage formerly gas, water injection, water injection formerly oil, water injection formerly gas, water injection formerly oil and gas, salt water disposal formerly oil, salt water disposal formerly gas, nonpotable water supply formerly oil, and nonpotable water supply formerly gas. Also included are the modifying statuses; abandoned, completion type uncertain, and (or) location uncertain. Location coordinates of wells contained within the Indiana Geological Surveys Petroleum Database Management System and their corresponding locations as shown on maps are believed to be reasonably accurate when portrayed on a scale of 1 inch to 1 mile (1:63,360). Although the coordinates for a great many locations in the database have been very accurately determined, past practices and inherent limitations on the accuracy with which a well was spotted on a 1:24,000-scale USGS topographic map have resulted in well coordinates that locate wells a small distance from their actual locations. Depending on circumstances, this distance could be as great as 100 feet, or rarely, somewhat more. In general, such locations are sufficiently accurate for most petroleum exploration and field mapping purposes. Additionally, it is important to note that new and revised data continually are being entered into the Petroleum Database Management System and, despite the use of careful procedures and proofing of the entered data, human error always remains a possibility. Every effort is made to correct errors and discrepancies whenever they are identified, but it is the responsibility of the user to verify any information to the extent it is deemed important.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This source provided the basis for the shape of field outlines digitized to create this dataset. Because MM58 was drawn at 1:550,000 on a now-obsolete basemap, the field outlines had to be re-digitized. Lines from MM58 provided a guide for that digitization, but the lines were not simply copied.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: IGS Miscellaneous Map 58, Map Showing Oil, Gas, and Gas Storage Fields in Indiana (MM58)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: This is statewide map which delineates the petroleum fields in Indiana.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This source is the original basis for lines originally digitized to produce IGS MM58. For PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP, the PEMs were used to verify spatial and attribute field information. Lines were not digitized from these maps to create PETROLEUM_FIELDS_IGS_IN.SHP.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: The Petroleum Exploration Map (PEM) series published by the Indiana Geological Survey is a set of 92 county maps that depict locations of known petroleum wells, petroleum fields, and gas storage projects. The maps are printed at 1:63,360-scale and utilize the old "General Highway and Transportation" base, which is known to contain a significant degree of horizontal spatial error.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
